segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: We have an upper intermediate lesson for you today.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节中高级课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: So, today we're talking about something that everyone who's ever lived away from home has felt before.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈论每个曾经离家生活的人都感受到的事情。

segments.en: Right, and that's the word we're going to preview today.
segments.cn: 对，这就是我们今天要预览的词。

segments.en: The word is homesick.
segments.cn: 这个词是思乡。

segments.en: Alright, so let's take a look at that in today's language preview.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们在今天的语言预览中看看这个。

segments.en: Alright, so homesick.
segments.cn: 好的，思乡。

segments.en: If you feel homesick, or you are homesick.
segments.cn: 如果你感到思乡，或者你正在思乡。

segments.en: Well, yeah, you could say, I'm homesick right now.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，你可以说，我现在很思乡。

segments.en: Or, are you feeling homesick?
segments.cn: 或者，你感到思乡吗？

segments.en: So, it's a word that means I miss my home, I miss my family, I'm far away, or I haven't seen my family in a long time, and for some reason you just feel sad.
segments.cn: 所以，这个词的意思是我想念我的家，我想念我的家人，我很远，或者我很久没见到我的家人，出于某种原因你就是感到悲伤。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a feeling.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种感觉。

segments.en: You feel a little bit depressed, you feel sad because you're homesick.
segments.cn: 你感到有点沮丧，因为你思乡。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Okay, so this is what's happening today in our dialogue, so let's listen to it for the first time.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们今天对话中发生的事情，让我们第一次听听。

segments.en: Tom, how are you?
segments.cn: Tom，你好吗？

segments.en: Hey, we missed you at the party last night, are you okay?
segments.cn: 嘿，昨晚的派对我们很想你，你还好吗？

segments.en: I don't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: I didn't really feel like going out.
segments.cn: 我真的不想出去。

segments.en: I guess I'm feeling a little homesick.
segments.cn: 我想我有点思乡。

segments.en: Come on, we've been through this already.
segments.cn: 来吧，我们已经经历过这个了。

segments.en: Look, I know the adjustment was hard when you first got here, but we agree that you were going to try and deal with it.
segments.cn: 看，我知道你刚来时适应很困难，但我们同意你要努力应对。

segments.en: I was.
segments.cn: 我是的。

segments.en: It's just that the holidays are coming up, and I won't be able to go home because I can't afford the airfare.
segments.cn: 只是假期快到了，我不能回家，因为我负担不起机票。

segments.en: I'm just longing for some of the comforts of home, like my mom's cooking and being around my family.
segments.cn: 我只是渴望一些家的舒适，比如我妈妈的饭菜和和家人在一起。

segments.en: Yeah, it can get pretty lonely over the holidays.
segments.cn: 是的，假期期间会很孤独。

segments.en: When I first got here, I'd get depressed and nostalgic for anything that reminded me of home.
segments.cn: 我刚来时，会因为任何让我想起家的事情而感到沮丧和怀旧。

segments.en: I almost let it get to me, but then I started going out, keeping myself busy, and before I knew it, I was used to it.
segments.cn: 我差点让它影响到我，但后来我开始出去，保持忙碌，不知不觉中，我就习惯了。

segments.en: I see what you mean, but I'm still bummed out.
segments.cn: 我明白你的意思，但我还是很沮丧。

segments.en: Okay, how does this sound?
segments.cn: 好吧，这样听起来怎么样？

segments.en: Let's get you suited up and hit the dance club tonight.
segments.cn: 让我们给你打扮一下，今晚去舞厅。

segments.en: I hear that an awesome DJ is playing, and there will be a lot of pretty single girls there.
segments.cn: 我听说有个很棒的DJ在演出，还有很多漂亮的单身女孩。

segments.en: You know, I could really go for that.
segments.cn: 你知道，我真的很想去。

segments.en: You don't mind being my wingman for tonight?
segments.cn: 你今晚不介意做我的搭档吗？

segments.en: Not at all.
segments.cn: 一点也不介意。

segments.en: It'll be fun.
segments.cn: 会很有趣。

segments.en: It will be like a boy's night out.
segments.cn: 就像是男孩们的夜晚。

segments.en: Well, kinda.
segments.cn: 嗯，有点。

segments.en: Great!
segments.cn: 太好了！

segments.en: I must warn you though, whatever happens, don't let me go on a drinking binge.
segments.cn: 不过我得警告你，无论发生什么，不要让我喝醉。

segments.en: Trust me, it's not a pretty picture.
segments.cn: 相信我，这可不好看。

segments.en: Alrighty, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So yeah, I guess he's very homesick.
segments.cn: 所以，是的，我想他非常思乡。

segments.en: Very homesick.
segments.cn: 非常思乡。

segments.en: And his friend is really worried.
segments.cn: 他的朋友真的很担心。

segments.en: Yeah, but actually I think this is common, right?
segments.cn: 是的，但其实我觉得这很常见，对吧？

segments.en: To be homesick during the holidays, like Christmas for example.
segments.cn: 在假期期间思乡，比如圣诞节。

segments.en: Oh man, it's the worst during the holidays, because you think of all the traditions and all the things that you normally do at home, and you're not doing them.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪，假期期间最糟糕，因为你会想到所有的传统和你通常在家做的事情，而你却没有做。

segments.en: So this is something we're going to talk more about a little bit later on, but let's take a look at some of the language that was used in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们稍后会更多讨论的事情，但让我们看看在语言收获中使用的一些语言。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: This first one is key, right?
segments.cn: 第一个是关键，对吧？

segments.en: So when you move away from home, or when you move to a new place, you have a period of adjustment.
segments.cn: 所以当你离开家，或者搬到一个新地方时，你会有一个适应期。

segments.en: So adjustment is kind of finding the right balance or doing something so that you can kind of feel comfortable.
segments.cn: 所以适应就是找到正确的平衡或做一些事情，让你感到舒适。

segments.en: Okay, so you have to adjust to your new life, life away from home.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你必须适应你的新生活，远离家的生活。

segments.en: Or your new environment.
segments.cn: 或者你的新环境。

segments.en: So many times people say, wow, moving to China must be a big adjustment.
segments.cn: 所以很多时候人们会说，哇，搬到中国一定是个大适应。

segments.en: So it means there's so many differences that it must take a long time to feel comfortable again.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着有很多差异，可能需要很长时间才能再次感到舒适。

segments.en: Okay, alright, so that's adjustment.
segments.cn: 好吧，好的，这就是适应。

segments.en: What else do we have?
segments.cn: 还有什么？

segments.en: Well, we've got this next phrase that's really important, I think, but often gets overlooked.
segments.cn: 嗯，我觉得下一个短语非常重要，但常常被忽视。

segments.en: We say the comforts of home, right?
segments.cn: 我们说家的舒适，对吧？

segments.en: Comforts of home.
segments.cn: 家的舒适。

segments.en: So comfort's pretty easy, right?
segments.cn: 所以舒适很简单，对吧？

segments.en: Feeling comfortable, so you have comfort.
segments.cn: 感到舒适，所以你有舒适。

segments.en: But the comforts of home are things that are different with every person.
segments.cn: 但家的舒适是每个人都不同的东西。

segments.en: But those are things that you have at your home or your childhood home or your parents' home that make you feel good and feel happy.
segments.cn: 但这些是你在家、童年家或父母家中拥有的东西，让你感到良好和快乐。

segments.en: So they're not only physical things or objects, right?
segments.cn: 所以它们不仅仅是物理的东西或物品，对吧？

segments.en: They can be like your mom's cooking or maybe even just spending time with your family.
segments.cn: 它们可以是你妈妈的饭菜，或者只是和家人在一起的时间。

segments.en: Right, or reading the newspaper with your dad or things that you're used to that you don't have anymore.
segments.cn: 对，或者和你爸爸一起看报纸，或者你习惯的事情，而你现在没有了。

segments.en: And so those are the comforts of home.
segments.cn: 所以这些就是家的舒适。

segments.en: I could say, Marco, do you miss the comforts of home in Ecuador?
segments.cn: 我可以问，Marco，你想念厄瓜多尔的家的舒适吗？

segments.en: I mean, do you have anything that's really... Of course, of course.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，你有什么真的... 当然，当然。

segments.en: I think one of the main things is actually not living in the city.
segments.cn: 我认为主要的事情之一实际上是没有住在城市里。

segments.en: Because I used to live in the valley, a little bit further away and kind of almost countryside.
segments.cn: 因为我以前住在山谷，离得远一点，几乎是乡村。

segments.en: So that's one of the comforts of home that I miss.
segments.cn: 所以这是我想念的家的舒适之一。

segments.en: You're making me nostalgic and I've never even been.
segments.cn: 你让我怀旧，而我甚至从未去过。

segments.en: All right, well, this is our next word, actually.
segments.cn: 好吧，这实际上是我们的下一个词。

segments.en: Right, nostalgic.
segments.cn: 对，怀旧。

segments.en: Nostalgic.
segments.cn: 怀旧。

segments.en: It's a feeling.
segments.cn: 这是一种感觉。

segments.en: I'm feeling nostalgic or he's just really nostalgic.
segments.cn: 我感到怀旧，或者他真的很怀旧。

segments.en: And so to be nostalgic is to kind of think about a time before or, you know, think positively about something that you experienced before.
segments.cn: 所以怀旧就是想起以前的时光，或者积极地想起你以前经历过的事情。

segments.en: So it's not usually a bad thing.
segments.cn: 所以这通常不是坏事。

segments.en: It's never a bad thing.
segments.cn: 这从来不是坏事。

segments.en: Nostalgia is a good, warm, fond memory of something.
segments.cn: 怀旧是对某种事情的美好、温暖的回忆。

segments.en: Of something from your past.
segments.cn: 对于你过去的某种事情。

segments.en: So you start thinking of something from your past that maybe brings nice, warm feelings.
segments.cn: 所以你开始想起一些可能带来美好、温暖感觉的过去的事情。

segments.en: Maybe a little bit sad because you miss those times.
segments.cn: 可能有点伤感，因为你想念那些时光。

segments.en: But it's usually thinking about the past.
segments.cn: 但通常是想起过去。

segments.en: Right, so I have nostalgia for my childhood.
segments.cn: 对，所以我对我的童年感到怀旧。

segments.en: I loved, you know, summers in Chicago when it was hot and the kids would play in the sprinkler.
segments.cn: 我喜欢，知道吗，夏天在芝加哥的时候，天气热，孩子们在喷洒器里玩。

segments.en: And I had my dog and, you know, it's a happy feeling.
segments.cn: 我有我的狗，知道吗，这是一种快乐的感觉。

segments.en: Right, so nostalgia would be the noun and nostalgic would be the adjective.
segments.cn: 对，所以怀旧是名词，怀旧的就是形容词。

segments.en: All right, and our last word for today on Language Takeaway is...
segments.cn: 好吧，今天语言收获的最后一个词是...

segments.en: bummed out.
segments.cn: 沮丧。

segments.en: Bummed out.
segments.cn: 沮丧。

segments.en: I'm bummed out.
segments.cn: 我很沮丧。

segments.en: We've got another feeling here, so we're all full of feelings today.
segments.cn: 我们这里还有另一种感觉，所以今天我们充满了情感。

segments.en: Bummed out is a sad feeling.
segments.cn: 失落是一种悲伤的感觉。

segments.en: So to be bummed is kind of slang and it means to be sad.
segments.cn: 所以失落是一种俚语，意思是感到悲伤。

segments.en: Okay, or disappointed.
segments.cn: 好吧，或者失望。

segments.en: Disappointed.
segments.cn: 失望。

segments.en: So you come into the office, Marco, and you look a little tired.
segments.cn: 所以你来到办公室，Marco，你看起来有点累。

segments.en: I said, are you okay?
segments.cn: 我问，你还好吗？

segments.en: Are you bummed out about something?
segments.cn: 你对什么感到失落吗？

segments.en: I can say, yeah, I lost my wallet last night, so I'm really bummed out.
segments.cn: 我可以说，是的，我昨晚丢了钱包，所以我真的很失落。

segments.en: Oh.
segments.cn: 哦。

segments.en: Or something like that.
segments.cn: 或者类似的事情。

segments.en: So yeah, you feel bummed out when something bad or sad happens to you.
segments.cn: 所以是的，当你遇到坏事或悲伤的事情时，你会感到失落。

segments.en: All right, so why don't we move on now to a couple of different phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们现在为什么不继续谈谈流利表达的几个不同短语呢？

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利表达。

segments.en: All right, this first one is something that you often say to old friends or family.
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个是你经常对老朋友或家人说的。

segments.en: You know, when you're friends with someone, they go through periods of happiness and sadness.
segments.cn: 你知道，当你和某人成为朋友时，他们会经历快乐和悲伤的时期。

segments.en: And so when someone's going through a down period again, you say, oh, we've been through this already.
segments.cn: 所以当某人再次经历低谷时，你会说，哦，我们已经经历过这个了。

segments.en: We've been through this already.
segments.cn: 我们已经经历过这个了。

segments.en: Or, you know, when you're giving someone advice and they never take your advice, you say, listen, we've been through this already.
segments.cn: 或者，你知道，当你给某人建议而他们从不采纳时，你会说，听着，我们已经经历过这个了。

segments.en: You should know by now that I... and then, you know, whatever the advice is.
segments.cn: 你现在应该知道我... 然后，你知道，无论建议是什么。

segments.en: So this has happened before or we have experienced this before or we already solved this problem or situation.
segments.cn: 所以这之前发生过，或者我们之前经历过，或者我们已经解决了这个问题或情况。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: You could imagine two bank robbers who are going over their plan for the tenth time and then one says to the other, hey, we've been through this already.
segments.cn: 你可以想象两个银行劫匪正在第十次讨论他们的计划，然后一个对另一个说，嘿，我们已经经历过这个了。

segments.en: You should know the plan by now.
segments.cn: 你现在应该知道计划。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是。

segments.en: All right, so we've been through this already.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们已经经历过这个了。

segments.en: They were talking about the adjustments and everything.
segments.cn: 他们在谈论调整和一切。

segments.en: And then what other phrase did they use?
segments.cn: 那么他们还用了什么短语？

segments.en: Well, the next couple of phrases have to do with the friend's suggestions because she has a lot of ideas to cheer her friend up, the depressed one.
segments.cn: 嗯，接下来的几个短语与朋友的建议有关，因为她有很多主意来让她的朋友振作起来，那个沮丧的朋友。

segments.en: And the first thing she says is, hey, let's hit the dance club.
segments.cn: 她说的第一件事是，嘿，我们去舞厅吧。

segments.en: Okay, let's hit the dance club or let's hit the dance floor tonight.
segments.cn: 好吧，今晚我们去舞厅或者去舞池。

segments.en: All right, so hit in this case doesn't mean like hit doesn't mean you're punching someone.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以在这种情况下，hit并不是指打人。

segments.en: It means to go to or to do.
segments.cn: 它意味着去或做。

segments.en: All right, so we can say let's go to the dance club tonight.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们可以说今晚去舞厅。

segments.en: Let's hit the dance club.
segments.cn: 我们去舞厅吧。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是。

segments.en: It doesn't have to be a dance club, but let's hit that concert tonight.
segments.cn: 不一定是舞厅，但今晚我们去那场音乐会吧。

segments.en: I really want to go there.
segments.cn: 我真的想去那里。

segments.en: Okay, so you can hit pretty much any place, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你几乎可以去任何地方，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是。

segments.en: And this is a very kind of spoken language.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常口语化的表达。

segments.en: So you wouldn't say this in your essays, but it's a good way to talk about plans with friends.
segments.cn: 所以你不会在论文中这样说，但这是与朋友谈论计划的好方法。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And our next word actually is kind of interesting because it's very colloquial and it's a wingman.
segments.cn: 我们下一个词其实很有趣，因为它非常口语化，是一个“副翼”。

segments.en: I can be your wingman tonight.
segments.cn: 我今晚可以做你的副翼。

segments.en: So wingman, you have to think about wing meaning side, not like a bird's wings.
segments.cn: 所以副翼，你要想象wing的意思是侧面，而不是鸟的翅膀。

segments.en: So a wing means side and a wingman is a guy who will go with you to a bar or a club to kind of help you find a date or a girl or someone to talk to.
segments.cn: 所以wing意味着侧面，副翼是一个会陪你去酒吧或俱乐部的人，帮助你找到约会对象或女孩或某人聊天。

segments.en: Okay, so this person, this wingman usually keeps you company and helps you decide maybe what girl to talk to or maybe even introduces you to someone at a club or at a restaurant or bar or whatever.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这个人，副翼通常陪伴你，帮助你决定和哪个女孩聊天，或者甚至在俱乐部或餐厅或酒吧或其他地方介绍你给某人。

segments.en: And you know, the key is that people don't like to go alone to bars, right?
segments.cn: 你知道，关键是人们不喜欢一个人去酒吧，对吧？

segments.en: Because you feel sad and then you look weird because you're all alone.
segments.cn: 因为你会感到孤独，然后看起来很奇怪，因为你一个人。

segments.en: And the same is true for girls.
segments.cn: 女孩也是如此。

segments.en: And so if a guy wants to go to a bar and he sees two girls, well, he has to have a friend to talk to the other girl.
segments.cn: 所以如果一个男孩想去酒吧，他看到两个女孩，他必须有一个朋友去和另一个女孩聊天。

segments.en: So wingman also helps in that sense.
segments.cn: 所以副翼在这个意义上也有帮助。

segments.en: He helps balance things.
segments.cn: 他帮助平衡事情。

segments.en: All right, so there's a whole science behind the wingman.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以副翼背后有一整套科学。

segments.en: Yeah, I'm sure if you look it up on Wikipedia, you'll find 10 pages of information.
segments.cn: 是的，我敢肯定如果你在维基百科上查一下，你会找到10页的信息。

segments.en: All right, so since they are going out tonight, they said it could be boys' night out.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以既然他们今晚要出去，他们说可能是男孩之夜。

segments.en: Okay, so this is another phrase you hear all the time, especially among young people.
segments.cn: 好吧，这又是一个你经常听到的短语，尤其是在年轻人中。

segments.en: Boys' night out and girls' night out.
segments.cn: 男孩之夜和女孩之夜。

segments.en: And so, you know, sometimes you spend a lot of time with your husband or your wife or your boyfriend or girlfriend and you just want to have some time with your friends.
segments.cn: 所以，你知道，有时你会花很多时间和你的丈夫或妻子或男朋友或女朋友在一起，而你只是想和朋友们一起度过一些时间。

segments.en: And so you call this girls' night for me, girls' night out.
segments.cn: 所以你称之为女孩之夜，女孩之夜。

segments.en: You just go out and you do girl things.
segments.cn: 你只是出去做一些女孩的事情。

segments.en: Guys' night out, you do other things.
segments.cn: 男孩之夜，你做其他事情。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So it's girls only or guys only.
segments.cn: 所以这是仅限女孩或仅限男孩。

segments.en: Boys' night out is only guys.
segments.cn: 男孩之夜只有男孩。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是。

segments.en: And that's why this is funny because it's the girl who says, hey, let's have boys' night out and she's not really a boy.
segments.cn: 这就是为什么这很有趣，因为是女孩说，嘿，我们来个男孩之夜，而她并不是真正的男孩。

segments.en: All right, great.
segments.cn: 好吧，太好了。

segments.en: And well, he agreed to go out and everything, but he warned her about him going on a drinking binge.
segments.cn: 他同意出去一切，但他警告她他会喝酒过量。

segments.en: Okay, now this is important.
segments.cn: 好吧，这很重要。

segments.en: A lot of people who are depressed or sad, when they drink, they drink a lot.
segments.cn: 很多人在沮丧或悲伤时，喝酒时会喝很多。

segments.en: And so binge means to do something in excess, to do it too much.
segments.cn: 所以 binge意味着过量做某事，做得太多。

segments.en: Okay, so a drinking binge would be drinking alcohol in excess, too much.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以饮酒过量就是过量饮酒，喝得太多。

segments.en: Too much, so getting drunk right away.
segments.cn: 太多，所以立刻喝醉。

segments.en: And it's not healthy and we do not condone it.
segments.cn: 这不健康，我们不支持。

segments.en: Right, exactly.
segments.cn: 对，正是。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So some very interesting phrases in this dialogue today.
segments.cn: 所以今天这个对话中有一些非常有趣的短语。

segments.en: I think we should listen to it one more time and we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 我认为我们应该再听一次，然后我们会马上回来。

segments.en: Tom, how are you?
segments.cn: Tom，你好吗？

segments.en: Hey, we missed you at the party last night.
segments.cn: 嘿，我们昨晚在派对上想念你。

segments.en: Are you okay?
segments.cn: 你还好吗？

segments.en: I don't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: I didn't really feel like going out.
segments.cn: 我真的不想出去。

segments.en: I guess I'm feeling a little homesick.
segments.cn: 我想我有点想家。

segments.en: Come on.
segments.cn: 来吧。

segments.en: We've been through this already.
segments.cn: 我们已经经历过这个了。

segments.en: Look, I know the adjustment was hard when you first got here, but we agree that you were going to try and deal with it.
segments.cn: 听着，我知道你刚来时调整很困难，但我们同意你会尝试应对。

segments.en: I was.
segments.cn: 我是。

segments.en: It's just that the holidays are coming up and I won't be able to go home because I can't afford the airfare.
segments.cn: 只是假期快到了，我不能回家，因为我负担不起机票。

segments.en: I'm just longing for some of the comforts of home, like my mom's cooking and being around my family.
segments.cn: 我只是渴望一些家的舒适，比如我妈妈的烹饪和和家人在一起。

segments.en: Yeah, it can get pretty lonely over the holidays.
segments.cn: 是的，假期期间会很孤独。

segments.en: When I first got here, I'd get depressed and nostalgic for anything that reminded me of home.
segments.cn: 我刚来时，会因为任何让我想起家的事情而感到沮丧和怀旧。

segments.en: I almost let it get to me, but then I started going out, keeping myself busy, and before I knew it, I was used to it.
segments.cn: 我差点让它影响我，但后来我开始出去，保持忙碌，不久我就习惯了。

segments.en: I see what you mean, but I'm still bummed out.
segments.cn: 我明白你的意思，但我还是很失落。

segments.en: Okay, how does this sound?
segments.cn: 好吧，这样听起来怎么样？

segments.en: Let's get you suited up and hit the dance club tonight.
segments.cn: 让我们给你换上衣服，今晚去舞厅。

segments.en: I hear that an awesome DJ is playing and there will be a lot of pretty single girls there.
segments.cn: 我听说有个很棒的DJ在演出，还有很多漂亮的单身女孩。

segments.en: You know, I could really go for that.
segments.cn: 你知道，我真的很想去。

segments.en: You don't mind being my wingman for tonight.
segments.cn: 你今晚不介意做我的搭档吧。

segments.en: Not at all.
segments.cn: 一点也不介意。

segments.en: It'll be fun.
segments.cn: 会很有趣。

segments.en: It will be like a boy's night out.
segments.cn: 就像是男孩们的夜晚。

segments.en: Well, kind of.
segments.cn: 嗯，有点像。

segments.en: Great!
segments.cn: 太好了！

segments.en: I must warn you though, whatever happens, don't let me go on a drinking binge.
segments.cn: 不过我得警告你，无论发生什么，不要让我喝醉。

segments.en: Trust me, it's not a pretty picture.
segments.cn: 相信我，这可不好看。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So speaking of homesick and holidays, do you actually get very depressed or homesick during Christmas?
segments.cn: 说到思乡和假期，你在圣诞节期间真的会感到很沮丧或思乡吗？

segments.en: I do.
segments.cn: 会的。

segments.en: Well, my family has a lot of Christmas traditions that are just really kind of wonderful and we do them every single year.
segments.cn: 我家有很多圣诞传统，真的很美好，我们每年都会做。

segments.en: And so the first time I spent Christmas away, I was living in Italy and it was kind of similar, but then the second time was when I was living in China.
segments.cn: 所以我第一次在外过圣诞节时，我住在意大利，感觉还算相似，但第二次是在中国。

segments.en: And China was just not the same.
segments.cn: 而中国就是不一样。

segments.en: No oven, so no Christmas cookies.
segments.cn: 没有烤箱，所以没有圣诞饼干。

segments.en: And no granny who pours vodka and eats meatballs.
segments.cn: 也没有奶奶倒伏特加和吃肉丸。

segments.en: And my mom not running around the kitchen.
segments.cn: 还有我妈妈不在厨房忙碌。

segments.en: You feel lonely and then all of a sudden you get a phone call.
segments.cn: 你感到孤独，然后突然接到一个电话。

segments.en: And it's the entire family.
segments.cn: 是整个家庭。

segments.en: And they're all together eating, having an amazing Christmas, and they think it's going to help you feel less homesick, but it makes you feel more homesick.
segments.cn: 他们在一起吃饭，过着美好的圣诞节，他们以为这会让你感觉不那么思乡，但其实让你更思乡。

segments.en: So you definitely have nostalgia for those days during the holidays.
segments.cn: 所以在假期里你肯定会怀念那些日子。

segments.en: But what about you?
segments.cn: 但你呢？

segments.en: I rarely get homesick, but yeah, sometimes during Christmas or New Year's.
segments.cn: 我很少感到思乡，但在圣诞节或新年时有时会。

segments.en: New Year's we usually have more unique traditions in Ecuador.
segments.cn: 新年我们在厄瓜多尔通常有更独特的传统。

segments.en: So it's very fun, the family gets together, we dance, we eat.
segments.cn: 所以非常有趣，家人聚在一起，我们跳舞，吃东西。

segments.en: But yeah, I've been away from home so long that I rarely get homesick anymore.
segments.cn: 但是的，我离家太久了，所以很少再感到思乡。

segments.en: But it's great to go back and spend time with the family.
segments.cn: 但回去和家人共度时光是很棒的。

segments.en: So after my visit to Ecuador, then I might get homesick for a little while, but then it goes away.
segments.cn: 所以在我访问厄瓜多尔后，我可能会思乡一小段时间，但很快就会好起来。

segments.en: Well, you guys should tell us, do you ever feel homesick?
segments.cn: 嗯，你们应该告诉我们，你们有没有感到思乡？

segments.en: And if you do, what do you feel homesick about?
segments.cn: 如果有，你们思乡的是什么？

segments.en: What do you miss?
segments.cn: 你们想念什么？

segments.en: Maybe mom's cooking, maybe family, maybe the comfort of home.
segments.cn: 也许是妈妈的烹饪，也许是家人，也许是家的舒适。

segments.en: Yeah, so we're curious to hear your answers.
segments.cn: 是啊，我们很想听听你们的答案。

segments.en: We have a website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们有一个网站，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: You can of course also leave us questions.
segments.cn: 当然你们也可以给我们留言。

segments.en: We're happy to answer those.
segments.cn: 我们很乐意回答。

segments.en: And until next time, everyone.
segments.cn: 下次再见，大家。

segments.en: Bye -bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: You're welcome.
segments.cn: 不客气。
